channel.title: angularjs on The long way through Software Craftsmanship
channel.description: Recent content in angularjs on The long way through Software Craftsmanship

item.title: Self-study in July 2015
item.description: I’ve grouped all small posts related to the self-study from July 2015 into a single post Clojure made simple I’ve watched this talk by Rich Hickey at the Java One. It references the talk Easy made simple polymorphism without inheritance; single dispatch on the first parameter Productive pair programming I’ve read this article about pair programming, using the driver & copilot technique, written by Carlos Bl√© Building Automated REST APIs with Python Investigating QA automation for REST APIs, I’ve read these slides about it

item.title: Internal training: Introduction to AngularJs
item.description: At a client, today I’ve done an internal training on angular js: we’ve prepared some slides and a live demo. The repository with all the information can be found here. Apparently, the training has been a success, given that most of the talent in the team is backend focused (as opposed to full-stack) and changing from java to javascript is not straight-forward. Note: this post has been created a posteriori, dated with the correct training timestamp.
